p: The change of R 0 and R t is connected to the proportion of individuals who have immunity in their body to that pathogen in that population. The alternative method of estimating R t for a pathogen including the population is by multiplying R 0 through the proportion of the population of individuals considered non-immune to that pathogen. In this perception, R 0 will only have a similar level of R t if there are no immune persons in the population. It indicates that any partial pre-existing immunity to the infecting elements is able to decrease the number of expected secondary cases emerging.
